_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP 2004 EXECUTIVE SUMMARY FOR PEDDIE CHEMICAL COMPANY, INC.

Peddie Chemical is a small business which is a distributor for janitorial cleaning chemicals, janitorial equipment, paper products, and industrial chemicals.  We do not manufacture any chemicals on site.  Our products are packaged before arrival at our facility.  The regulated substance that we handle is chlorine.  The maximum inventory at any one time is sixty (60) 150# cylinders of chlorine gas (9000#).  The cylinders are received by ground transportation in containment racks and are removed from the truck by forklift and placed in our warehouse.   Upon receiving an order for a cylinder(s), the cylinder is placed on the Peddie Chemical truck for delivery to the customer.   We are not responsible for  connecting or disconnecting cylinders for our customers.  If a customer receives a cylinder that later develops a leak, the customer will call us to remove the cylinder.  It is then taken to our warehouse where trained personnel can handle the problem.  We have personal respirator equipment and the Chlorine Emergency Kit "A" for handling small or minor leaks.  If the situation requires attention in which our employees are not trained, we then call Allied Chemical to assess the situation and to remove the cylinder from the warehouse.  Allied Chemical has always been very timely in helping us with a cylinder leak problem. 

Peddie Chemical Company is required to comply with the rules and reulations of OSHA 29 CFR, DOT 40 CFR 172.704, EPA 49 CFR Part 68 and Florida State EPCRA.  This facility is operated in accordance with the recommendations from the Chlorine Institute.  There have been no accidents to report for the last five years.  

Our facility's Emergency Response Plan is based upon the Chlorine Institute's Pamphlet 64, Emergency Response Plans for Chlorine Facilities.  We are coordinated with the Local Emergency Response Committee as well as the local Tallahassee Fire Department in case of emergencies.

Although our employees are trained to handle minor leaks in cylinders, we are a Non-Responding Facility and would depend upon local response agencies in the event of a major chemical release.           

We will continue to seek training from various sources such as OSHA consultation services, the Chlorine Institute, and Allied Universal to ensure the safety of our employees and the community.
